name: indemonstrable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be proved: The correctness of moral claims is frequently indemonstrable, and is therefore likely to be controversial. This statement is self-evident and therefore indemonstrable.
More examplesFewer examplesAristotle's account of the indemonstrable first premises of the sciences has often been regarded as a difficult text to interpret.It is only by logic that we can understand the indemonstrable first principles of science.As the Greek anatomist Herophilus said: "Wisdom is indemonstrable, wealth useless, and speech impotent if health be absent."
